items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.
items.item_text: Information on Public Comments and Disability Access
items.item_text_raw: 2. Information on Public Comments and Disability Access

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details: The Board of Trustees adopted the District's operating budget at its special meeting on September 28, 2010.  As required by Board Policy 6250, subsequent budget transfers and revisions must be approved by the Board of Trustees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the resolution authorizing the budget transfers and revisions of funds within expenditure accounts, authorizing the appropriation of the receipt of unanticipated revenues in certain programs, and authorizing the reversal of appropriations in certain programs due to the non-receipt of program revenues.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. District policy adopted on April 10, 2007 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the bid limit (effective January 1, 2011, bid limit has increased from $78,500 to $78,900) should have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes the purchase orders for administratively-approved contracts exceeding $750, as well as additional contracts that, although are not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the attached contracts and purchase orders for the period of December 10, 2010 - January 9, 2011.

items.item_details: Faculty reassigned time for spring 2011 includes general funds and grant funded assignments.  Reassigned time allocated to faculty is compensated at the standard instructional rates called for in the current Faculty Association Collective Bargaining Agreement.

items.item_details: Oral reports will be given by members of the Board of Trustees.
Oral reports will be given by Chancellor Rita Cepeda.
Oral reports will be given by the college presidents.
Oral reports will be given by the constituency representatives.

Proposition 39, which governs the District’s general obligation bonds, requires the establishment of a citizens’ oversight committee.  Following the passage of Measure G-2004 on November 2, 2004, the Board of Trustees took action on May 10, 2005 to establish a Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee.    Measure G-2010 was passed by the voters on November 2, 2010, after which the Board of Trustees took action on December 14, 2010 to amend and restate the bylaws to allow for the existing committee to support both Measure G-2004 and Measure G-2010.
 
The Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee is required by statute to meet at least annually to review the District’s Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 bond projects plan and to ensure that bond funds are being appropriately used as authorized by the voters.  There are no penalties defined in law for failure to convene a citizens’ oversight committee; however, the spirit of the law contemplates that districts will make every reasonable effort to ensure that the committee functions at least once each year to fulfill its statutory duties and the District anticipates regular bi-monthly meetings.
 
Pursuant to Proposition 39, the Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee is required to have a minimum of seven (7) members representing the following groups:
 
- One (1) student active in a community college support group, such as student government
 
- One (1) business community located in the District
 
- One (1) senior citizens’ organization
 
- One (1) bona-fide taxpayers’ association
 
- One (1) support organization for the District, such as SJECCD Foundation
 
- Two (2) community at-large
 
The District has strived to maintain the seven-person committee as structured above.  It has been determined that the committee’s function would benefit by expanding that number in the categories where there are additional qualified applicants.  This will also assist in the ability for a quorum to be reached at the regularly scheduled meetings.
 
Kathy Kyne continues to serve representing a Senior Citizens' Organization.   Staff will continue to seek candidates to fill two of the required categories; namely, a small business representative and a representative of a support organization for the District. Listed below is a list of individuals recommended for appointment to the Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Oversight Committee commencing February 9, 2011. The Board of Trustees will be provided with a follow-up recommendation when additional candidates are identified.
 
        
Representing                       Appointee                       Term Expires    
Community At-Large          Joseph Becker                February 8, 2013
Community At-Large          Daniel Kojiro                   February 8, 2013
Community At-Large          Spencer Horowitz          February 8, 2013
Community At-Large          Carol Lizak                       February 8, 2013
Community At-Large          Ann Mancuso Engdahl  February 8, 2013
Taxpayers’ Association       Jimmy Nguyen               February 8, 2013
Student Representative     Raymond Porras            February 8, 2013
Student Representative     Linda Lam                       February 8, 2013
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the appointments of the Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee members as listed in this board item for a term of two years commencing February 9, 2011.

items.item_details:
On January 22-23  board member of both;  the California Community College Trustees (CCCT)  and the Chief Executive Officers of the California Community Colleges (CEOCC) developed an advocacy plan to impact the Governor's Proposed Budget for the 2011-2012 fiscal year.  In particular, a proposed resolution was drafted urging local board to consider adoption of this resolution including key priorities and principles that should be considered by the Governor in making final determinations regarding reductions to the community college budget.   The resolution contains four major points: 
(1) request for a balanced approach to budgeting included the extension of temporary tax revenues (2)  redirection of the proposed student fee increase to reduce the proposed apportionment cut to community colleges  (3) opposition to reductions in apportionment based on changes to the "census date" and (4) supporting the right of California voters to be given the opportunity to approve parcel taxes with a 55% vote to backfill budget cuts.
	 
Upon the adoption of said resolution, local Boards are urged to submit the resolution to the Governor's Office and to provide a copy to the Budget Advocacy Center established by the Community College League for California (CCLC) for use in future advocacy efforts.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the San Jose/Evergreen Community College District join with other governing boards systemwide in suppport of the Community College Budget Priorities Principles for the 2011-2012 fiscal year.
items.item_text: Resolution in Support of California Community Colleges Budget Priorities and Principles
items.item_text_raw: Resolution in Support of California Community Colleges Budget Priorities and Principles

items.item_details: Chancellor Cepeda and Vice Chancellor Hawk will provide a budget update.
Chancellor Cepeda will provide a legislative update.

Information will include a review of the Second Quarter Budget Report for the period ending December 31, 2010.  The state budget, current District financial position, and estimates for FY2011/2012, FY2012/2013, and FY2013/2014 will also be discussed.
	 
The Second Quarter Budget Report was provided under separate cover.  The report can also be accessed by the public on the District's web site at http://www.sjeccd.edu/business/AdminServices/Pages/BudgetReports.aspx .

items.item_details:
BACKGROUND:  
Pursuant to Government Code Section 3547, the San Jose/Evergreen Community College District presents their Reopener Proposal for 2011-2012.  The District requests that issues in the following articles be negotiated for 2011-2012:  
	 
Article   8 – Salary
Article   9 – Adjunct Faculty and Substitutes
Article 17 – Benefits
Article 18 – Retirement
	 
The District reserves the right to add, amend, delete and/or change any of these proposals.
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Present the District’s contract reopener proposal for 2011-2012, and announcement of a public hearing to be conducted at the February ­­8, 2011 Board meeting.
